intro: Graphorkis maculata, commonly known as the spotted orchid, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive spotted leaves and delicate flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky outcrops. Its flowers are usually pale green or yellow with red or brown markings, and they bloom during the warmer months. Graphorkis maculata is often found in association with other orchid species in its native habitat.
